com.rohitsood.urlybird.util
Class SpringLayoutUtilities

java.lang.Object
  com.rohitsood.urlybird.util.SpringLayoutUtilities
public final class SpringLayoutUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Utility that helps in the layout of user interface components that use the SpringLayout. Provides a generic way of taking a Container object and creating a form. in a standard grid All spacing and sizing issues are encapsulated here.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Rohit Sood

Method Detail

makeSpringGrid

public static void makeSpringGrid(java.awt.Container container,
                                  int rows,
                                  int cols,
                                  int x,
                                  int y,
                                  int padX,
                                  int padY)
This method is used to create a grid view for the form. All components in the container are layout as specified in the row and columns. Padding and initial coordinates within the container is provided for embellishments.

Parameters:
container - The container to layout. Component's layout must be a SpringLayout.
rows - The number of rows.
cols - The number of columns.
x - The initial x co-ordinate.
y - The inital y co-ordinate.
padX - The padding in the x-axis among components.
padY - The padding in the y-axis among components.

resolveWidth

private static int resolveWidth(java.awt.Container container,
                                int rows,
                                int cols,
                                int padX,
                                int startX)
Figures out the maximum width of the component across the container.

Parameters:
container - The container which containes the components.
rows - The number of rows in the container.
cols - The number of columns in the container.
padX - The horizontal padding.
startX - The initial left padding.
Returns:
The maximum width of the component.

resolveHeight

private static int resolveHeight(java.awt.Container container,
                                 int rows,
                                 int cols,
                                 int padY,
                                 int startY)
Figures out the maximum width of the component across the container.

Parameters:
container - The container which containes the components.
rows - The number of rows in the container.
cols - The number of columns in the container.
padY - The vertical padding.
startY - The inital top padding.
Returns:
The maximum height of the component.

setMaxHeight

private static void setMaxHeight(java.awt.Container container,
                                 int cols,
                                 int maxRowHeight,
                                 int startY,
                                 int row)
Sets the y coordinate of every component in the container. Sets height of the SpringLayout.Constraints.

Parameters:
container - The container which contains the components.
cols - The total number of columns in the container.
maxRowHeight - The maximum height of the row.
startY - The starting y coordinate of the components.
row - The row of the component for which the height needs to be set.

getMaxHeight

private static int getMaxHeight(java.awt.Container container,
                                int cols,
                                int r)
Gets the maximum height of the row.

Parameters:
container - The container that holds the components.
cols - The total number of columns.
r - The row number.
Returns:
The maximum height.

setMaximumWidth

private static void setMaximumWidth(java.awt.Container container,
                                    int rows,
                                    int cols,
                                    int maxColumnWidth,
                                    int startX,
                                    int c)
Sets the x coordinate of every component in the container.

Parameters:
container - The container that holds the components.
rows - The total number of rows.
cols - The total number of columns.
maxColumnWidth - The maximum column width.
startX - The starting point in the x axis.
c - The column for which the width has to be set.

getMaximumWidth

private static int getMaximumWidth(java.awt.Container container,
                                   int rows,
                                   int cols,
                                   int c)
Gets the maximum width of the row.

Parameters:
container - The container that has the components.
rows - The total number of rows.
cols - The total number of columns.
c - The column for which the maximum width is required.
Returns:
The maximum width.

getComponentID

private static int getComponentID(int row,
                                  int col,
                                  int totalColumns)
Gets the component id given a particular row and column.

Parameters:
row - The row in which the component resides.
col - The column in which the component resides.
totalColumns - The total number of columns in the grid.
Returns:
The id of the component.

getPreferredDimension

public static java.awt.Dimension getPreferredDimension(java.awt.Container container,
                                                       int mode)
Calculates the preferred dimension of the component given a mode. It takes the mode based on the mode constants and calculates the preferred size.

Parameters:
container - The container for which the preferred size is to be determined.
mode - The mode for which the calculation takes place.
Returns:
The preferred Dimension of the container.
